citation.article-title: Globicatella sulfidifaciens sp. nov., isolated from purulent infections in domestic animals
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Globicatella sulfidifaciens sp. nov.
Globicatella sulfidifaciens (sul'fi.di.fa'ci.ens. L. n. sulfidum sulphide; L. v. facere produce; N.L. adj. sulfidifaciens sulphide-producing)
Gram-variable cocci showing the characteristics of Gram-positive cocci, occurring singly, in pairs and in short chains.
Grows in 6.5% NaCl but not on bile±aesculin agar.
Other characteristics are given in Table 2.
G+C content of the DNA is 35-36 mol%.
Isolated from lung and joint lesions in ruminants and a pig.
Type strain is LMG 18844T (=CCUG 44365T), which was isolated from a bovine lung in Belgium; its G+C content is 35.8 mol%.
Its biochemical characteristics are as described above for the species.
